channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12428] region_mover.rb script is broken if port is not specified
item.description:
TypeError: can't convert nil into String
getFilename at /home/user/hbase/bin/region_mover.rb:466
unloadRegions at /home/user/hbase/bin/region_mover.rb:327
(root) at /home/user/hbase/bin/region_mover.rb:515
item.summary: region_mover.rb script is broken if port is not specified

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch to get the default port correctly in the region_mover.rb script. Verified locally.
New version after Jesse's comments.
+1 looks good to me. We need a trunk patch too, if you have a moment Sameer Vaishampayan.

This message is automatically generated.
I don't quite follow, what was wrong before? Is it the unless part that throws the exception?

Lars Hofhansl the problem is that is doesn't handle the port correctly. If there isn't one specified, it will throw an exception when it tries to cleanup old files. However, we are also doing the "... unless port" check in two different places, which is not as clean as it could be.

So this just sets up the port in a single place, if its not set via the command line.

Sameer Vaishampayan says this should also apply to master (just checked, seems like it does). I'll be applying this afternoon/evening to master and 0.98 branches, unless there are objections.

Are there any other branches I should hit too stack?
master, branch-1 and 0.98 Jesse Yates +1 on patch if you've test the script still works. Good stuff.

I believe you guys.

Still weird, we're pulling this out of any method into the global context so it's executed as soon as the script is loaded by the interpreter, and set as a default everywhere? At least warrants a comment, I think.

Isn't this (-maybe) a cleaner fix? Keep logic local to the method where it is needed.
Sorry to be pedantic.

If you prefer your version here's a +1 for that too

This message is automatically generated.

Isn't this (-maybe) a cleaner fix? Keep logic local to the method where it is needed.

No, stop it Lars. Its a smaller fix but not better. This script is called once from the outside and has a single flow of execution. It already does the correct check for the hostname, but doesn't check the port being set. That means you end up having the two null checks local to the load/unload methods for a variable that should be script-global anyways. This way its checked one place - think of it as setting up the defaults if user didn't provide overrides - and never has to be worried about again.

But thanks for the +1 on the original. I'll be committing today, if thats ok with you boss.
All good
